Hi all,
when crawling a small number of domains it's easy to get the
downloaded/discovered ratio to 95-98% in half a days time. But the end
is slow.

It often looks like there's one domain left and one thread fetches a
single doc every now and then. When downloaded/discovered stays at 99%
for a day I usually terminate the job and think that a couple of docs
remained somewhere on the way. 

But then I wonder how much remains uncollected and what paths might
have opened up. For one job the rate has been 99% (16209/16241) over
24 hours. I somehow think this means about 30 docs uncollected. But
'Crawl report' page says

URIs
Discovered: 16241
Queued: -178 (queue size <> 30)
Finished: Total 16419   Success 16209  Failed 159 Disregarded 51 

It would be nice to see all URIs waiting in queue before terminating
jobs. Frontier report shows some queues but only their top URIs?

****
I've haven't been caught in loops lately, maybe because I've added
some filters to profile. But it's sometimes hard to guess in advance
what might cause a loop. Couldn't heritrix monitor itself => when one
domain starts to fill queues heritrix could move URIs from other
domains upwards and leave the possible loop causing URIs for a later
time?

kk
